perturbation.original_text: 4.1 Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with thefollowing provisions: Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the service fee ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge Service Fee from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be equal to the amount of profits gained by Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. Party B shall have the right to adjust the amount of Service Fee at its own discretion, without the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries. Party A shall cause its subsidiaries to pay the Service Fee in respect of Party B's Services provided to such subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1 Party A and Party B agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with the following provisions: Party B may charge, periodically, a service fee ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be determined through mutual agreement between Party A and Party B, taking into account market conditions and the scope of services provided. Party A shall cause its subsidiaries to pay the Service Fee in respect of Party B's Services provided to such subsidiaries.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Party B has the right to adjust the service fee at its own discretion, without Party A's consent. The modified text changes this by stating that the fee will be determined through 'mutual agreement'. This directly contradicts the original statement, creating uncertainty about how the service fee is determined and potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 6.1 Prior to the expiration of the Term of Cooperation , this Agreement shall only be terminated upon occurrence of the followingcircumstances: 6.1.1 Party B shall have the right to terminate this Agreement in advance without the prior written consent from Party A, bysending a written notice to Party A but Party A may not terminate or rescind this Agreement; 6.1.2 One Party requests to terminate this Agreement when the other Party is declared bankrupt in accordance with the laws; 6.1.3 Party B fails to provide Party B's Services to Party A for more than three consecutive years due to the force majeure event.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.1 Prior to the expiration of the Term of Cooperation, this Agreement may be terminated under the following circumstances: 6.1.1 Party B retains the right to terminate this agreement at its sole discretion with written notice to Party A; however, Party A's ability to terminate this agreement will be subject to mutual agreement with Party B. 6.1.2 Termination may be initiated by either party if the other becomes insolvent. 6.1.3 In the event Party B is unable to provide services due to unforeseen circumstances, the agreement may be terminated.
perturbation.explanation: Original text 6.1.1 states Party A may not terminate or rescind this agreement. But the changed text states "Party A's ability to terminate this agreement will be subject to mutual agreement with Party B". This directly contradicts the original statement, creating uncertainty about termination of the contract.

perturbation.original_text: 12.3 The Parties agree that any and all intellectual property researched and developed, created and invented by the Parties (including their employees) in the course of performance of this Agreement shall be owned by Party B. For the purpose of this Article 12.3, "Intellectual Property" means the patent, patent application right, trademark, service mark, logo, image, trade name, internet domain name, design right, copyright (including copyright of computer software) and moral rights, database right, right of semiconductor design drawing, utility model, proprietary technology and other intellectual property that are registered and unregistered including those that have applied for registration, as well as all other rights or protection methods with same or similar effect on a global scope.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.3 Intellectual property rights arising from this Agreement shall be jointly owned by both parties, with the specific allocation of rights to be determined on a case-by-case basis through mutual agreement. For the purpose of this Article 12.3, "Intellectual Property" encompasses patents, trademarks, copyrights, and any other form of intellectual creation developed during the term of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly states that all intellectual property developed during the agreement belongs solely to Party B. The revised version contradicts this by stating that intellectual property is jointly owned, and the allocation is determined on a case-by-case basis with mutual agreement. This creates uncertainty about ownership, directly conflicting with the initial unambiguous assignment of rights.
